name: Primavera Hostel

reviews.text: We had a wonderful time staying here. Kristina was a great host, very accommodating...she recommended great spots to visit to eat, drink and explore. The hostel was welcoming and had a nice relaxed personality and charm. We loved the ease of the location and would definitely stay there again. We also liked how the hostel was not a party hostel and you could chill out or gather in the sitting area.
reviews.title: Great value with charm

reviews.text: Primavera is probably the best hostel I have ever visited! I spent one week there and enjoyed it from minute one. It's cozy, with 2 dorms and a few private rooms, so I think it is the perfect size to be able to make friends and share experiences. It's always very clean. The kitchen is fully equipped, you can cook your meals and there are always some free snacks you can have. It is a little far away from the touristy fuss of Las Ramblas or the beaches, but convenient to visit Gracia, Passeig de Gracia or Sagrada Familia, and anyway the subway station is literally 30 seconds away walking. It can get very hot in the summer, but the very friendly and helpful staff can give you extra fans if the air conditioning is not enough.
reviews.title: Totally recommended

reviews.text: friendly, familiary hostel, with great receptionist, full equipment, kitchen with dishes, situated near Sagrada familia, the small buffet in ground floor, wifi connection, ¨receptionist helps with idea of visiting places, a bigger number of bathrooms, cheap price
reviews.title: Great hostel

reviews.text: Ive been in this hostel in last july for almost 2 weeks . It was after 2 really bad hostels and in the moment i came to primavera i knew i found my home in barcelona.
reviews.title: Great hostel with great people!

reviews.text: The staff is great! Kristina ,the mom of the hostel ,take care of everything and always there if you need help,the people in general were so nice and we had a lot of great conversations in the salon and we even did a little trip together .
reviews.title: A decent value

reviews.text: Primavera Hostel has heart. I was very lucky to spend four nights in this wonderful hostel -- situated in a gorgeous historic building -- at the beginning of June and would recommend it without reservation to other guests. Rooms are absolutely spotless, very well decorated (the designer has done a phenomenal job!), and comfortable. This is a hostel that feels more like a cozy shared flat, and has a nice mix of common areas and two kitchens. It also has spotless bathrooms with strong, hot showers. I never needed to wait to use a shower or toilet.
reviews.title: Truly outstanding hostel

reviews.text: Location is outstanding -- just a few seconds away from a metro station with two lines, five minutes to Sagrada Familia, and just 10-15 minutes walking to other major sites, including both Gaudi houses. There are also some great restaurants and bars near by (ask for directions to the Italian one, trust me!) that represent exceptional value -- these are places frequented by locals, and not the tourist traps present closer to the sea. At night, I would recommend you walk 10 minutes to the Vila de Gracia area for great pubs.
reviews.title: Nice and clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best feature of this hostel, though, is the staff. They bend over backwards to make sure you have a great time in Barcelona and to promote a friendly atmosphere in the hostel.
reviews.title: First and great experience of a hostel

reviews.text: Is there anything missing? Not really -- I just wish there was a cork board available to have left a note saying how very much I adored the hostel and staff! Thank you, Primavera!
reviews.title: Wonderful place!

reviews.text: Primavera hostel is in a really old and exotic building. Great location. The lady who manages everything was really helpful, she helped me to spend my (only) 2 days stay in the most efficient way. Marked the areas which are "must visit" on map, and helped through all the other staff i needed. The rooms, beds and the common areas are completely clean and peaceful. You will find a very friendly atmosphere in there.
reviews.title: A decent hostel

reviews.text: It's my second time at this super cool hostel and I just love it! it's very clean and quiet (when needed..) and just a walking distance to the center. it also was refurnished lately and the service is sooo kind and smiley that I wish I could stay longer.
reviews.title: I love this place!!!

reviews.text: most recommended!
reviews.title: New and clean Hostel!

reviews.text: if you're in Barcelona and looking for the best place to stay in (in a very good prices too!)' go there you wont be sorry...
reviews.title: Unique excellence at the heart of Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just spent two nights in a dorm in this hostel and I'm really pleased with what we got, particularly compared to a year of travelling in Australia and a couple of nights in a 3* Aparthotel in BCN. It's located on the 1st floor of an older building just 5 mins walking from Passeig de Gracia and a Metro station is just around the corner. Taxi from mid-rambla is around 7€. They have dorms and privat rooms, well equipped kitchen. There's a music school just above the hostel so you might be lucky to get some live music! The Hostel is newly furnished, well run, rooms have lockers. There's wifi, of course, and a cafe downstairs serves cheap but nice Catalan breakfast. There is actually nothing negative to say, so don't bother about taking a 2* or 3* hotel which further away from the city center... Thanks Kristina!
reviews.title: Amazing Hostel!!

reviews.text: The words cannot explain the positive experience that a hostel of such calibre can offer...
reviews.title: The best hostel I have stayed in...

reviews.text: Came back here for a second time because it was so good the first time. Everything was perfect. Amazing location, super friendly staff (especially Kristina, very comfortable beds, the warmest, most powerful and cleanest showers ever seen in a hostel and great value for money. Ambiance is very chilled and friendly, went by myself both times and met lots of great people very easily. Can't recommend enough! Book it already!
reviews.title: Absolutely the best place to stay in barcelona. Perhaps the best hostel in the world..?

reviews.text: My best experience!!Great location,only 5 minutes walking from Sagrada, Clean and comfortable. Free WIFI in all areas, free coffee and tea, warm public areas. 6 Bathrooms are very clean. I booked 6-beds mixed dormitory, but they arranged a girls-only room for me:) Staffs are sooooooo friendly and if possible I'll be back again. Kristina is very very helpful, and even help me sent my forgotten stuff. Sooo many reasons to 4in love with here. I will tell all my friends who wanna travel to Barcelona, Primavera Hostel NO.1 choice!!!
reviews.title: Excellent！！Warm like a family

reviews.text: the hostel was amazing, very comfortable and close to the center, and the service was warm and inviting, Christina even made delicious cookies for us.
reviews.title: awsome hostle

reviews.text: i really recommend visiting this hostel', we'll definitly come back
reviews.title: An excellent hostel

reviews.text: Just came back from Barcelona, stayed in the hostel 3 night. It's in a great location, a walking distance from a lot of places. The staff are great, they are nice and willing to help. The hostel is clean and feels like home. I would come back, for sure.
reviews.title: Something Else :)

description: Primavera Hostel is located in a building of the Barcelona of the early twentieth century, which has been renovated and transformed into a dynamic, bright and warm space preserving the touch of traditional architecture and decoration but with designs that transport it to modernity.Primavera Hostel is designed for a kind of traveler who is looking for comfort, good service but without having a high budget. We offer spacious private rooms and bedrooms very well distributed. We are committed to making your stay comfortable and safe.We have wireless Internet service, lockers, a wide kitchen and living room where you can also share with people from around the world! We are located in the heart of Barcelona, just meters from the famous Gaudi Church: The Holy Family and a few minutes from downtown. From our hostel you can go to all the attractions of the city quickly and safely due we are to a few steps from metro stations and bus stops. The hostel provides a double/twin, triples and quad room and as well a beds in a 6 beds dorm. There is a full equipped kitchen for the guest use where you can cook and make a coffee exactly like at home. All the rooms have shared shower and bathroom. As well, you can enjoy and relax in our living room with a television, big sofas and good books. A computer is located in the living room for the guests use for free! and as well, free wifi in all the rooms.
